sector.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc
sector.translation[0].definitions[0].not: public/private sector (=business controlled by the government or by private companies)
sector.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the agricultural sector of the economy
sector.translation[0].definitions[1].def: one of the parts into which an area is divided, especially for military purposes
sector.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: an economic sector
The country is making efforts to expand such economic sectors as tourism and information technology.
the agricultural/manufacturing/industrial sector
As the industrial sector grew, more and more of the population moved to the cities.
the service sector
The proportion of service sector jobs within the economy has grown.
the financial/banking sector
The UK financial sector is looking healthier than ever.
the public sector
The government has been holding down pay in the public sector.
the private sector
Generally speaking, employees in the private sector are well rewarded.
the voluntary sector
The voluntary sector has an important role in tackling urban deprivation.
an important sector
Sport is now recognized as an important sector of economic activity.
a key sector
They identified cars and electronics as key sectors in the economy.
the rented sector
We have lost 2 million homes from the rented sector.
sector.translation[1].definitions[0].def: all the organizations or companies in a particular area of activity, industry etc
sector.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The electronics sector accounted for revenue of Â£940.4 million.
The performance of the troubled housing sector is being watched very closely.
the growth of jobs in the service sector
